intro: Hitcheniopsis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered hitcheniopsis, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and pinnately compound leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and herbal practices.
